channel.title: Video - Digg
channel.description: Video on Digg: the best articles, videos, tweets, and original content that the web is talking about right now

item.title: Teens Are Completed Flabbergasted By The Challenge To Dial A Rotary Phone
item.description: You'd think it wouldn't be this hard. You would be wrong.

item.title: Man Tests Out How Many Rubber Bands Can Make A Watermelon Explode And The Result Is Glorious
item.description: Who needs to use a knife to slice open a watermelon when you can make one explode with many, many rubber bands?

item.title: Students From A Stunt Double School Take Turns 'Punching' Each Other In Ingenious Video
item.description: Just because you have to respect the rules of social distancing doesn't mean you can't knock each other out.

item.title: It's No Coincidence That Various TV News Shows Sound The Same — They All Have Identical Scripts
item.description: This mashup of local TV news networks gets a bit robotic when you hear over 30 news anchors say the same thing. As they themselves will admit, "this is extremely dangerous to our democracy."

item.title: Man Almost Gets Run Over By A Truck, Casually Walks On As If Nothing's Happened
item.description: Not everyone has a close brush of death and then walks it off as if there's nothing to it.

item.title: Watch An Animatronics Engineer Create A Giant, 3D-Printed LEGO Go-Kart
item.description: To create a giant Go-Kart he could potentially sit on and steer, engineer Matt Denton 3D-printed LEGO parts 8.3 times larger than a real LEGO car.

item.title: Trump Impersonator Thinks He's Figured Out Who's Responsible For The Lockdown Crisis
item.description: Is Zoom behind the coronavirus lockdowns? Trump has a theory.

item.title: An Alternative History Of Post-WWII Hollywood Is Explored In Trailer Of Ryan Murphy's New Show 'Hollywood'
item.description: Murphy's vision of post-war Hollywood is one where people of color managed to break into Hollywood's studio system. "Hollywood" will be available for streaming on Netflix on May 1.

item.title: Russian Olympic Swimmer Julia Evimova Couldn't Swim In A Pool, So She Is Practicing In The Kitchen Instead Like This
item.description: Please, please do not try this at home.

item.title: Brad Pitt Has Funny Cameo As Weatherman In John Krasinski's Latest 'Some Good News' Episode
item.description: In addition to having Brad Pitt report on the weather, Krasinski also invited Chance the Rapper and Billie Eilish to perform for a virtual prom he held for high-schoolers who didn't have the chance to go to their prom.

item.title: A Runaway Pig Was Chased By Stamford Police Officers For 45 Minutes, Until It Was Captured. Here Are The Highlights
item.description: At one point, a police officer proclaimed it "a stand-off."

item.title: Here's What Hogwarts Fashion Would Look Like In Every Era From The 1920s To 2020s
item.description: We petition this to be the official costumes of the Harry Potter movies.
item.kicker: HARRY POTTER AND THE DASHING HALLOWS

item.title: The Convoluted Reason Why You Can't Name A File 'CON' On A Windows Computer
item.description: It may be a surprising revelation, but it turns out you can't name a folder, an image or a text file "Con" on a Windows machine.

item.title: Here's How Our Immunity Responses To COVID-19 Compare With Other Diseases
item.description: From chicken pox to the common cold, here's where our immune response to COVID-19 might lie on the spectrum.

item.title: This Is What Happens When A Dog Doesn't Keep A Social Distance Away From A Cat
item.description: Just because the cat is smaller doesn't mean that the dog has the upper hand in the relationship.

item.title: Cat Has Preciously Wholesome Reaction To Seeing Baby For The First Time
item.description: This is the best meet-cute ever.

item.title: Here's A Brilliant Parody Of Every Introvert's Reaction To The Coronavirus
item.description: "I guess I feel very sorry for extroverts right now. They must be struggling, unlike me."

item.title: We Have No Idea How This Dog Fended Off An Attack By A Leopard
item.description: After wrestling with the dog, the leopard was finally scared off by the sounds of a passing car.

item.title: The 'Impossible' Science Experiment That Makes Water Climb Uphill
item.description: It's not black magic, but a physical phenomenon called the leidenfrost effect.

item.title: Here's What Happens When You Bury 110 Pounds Of Dynamite In A Snow Dump Site And Explode It
item.description: Will it result in a big bang or a whimper as snow meets detonated dynamite?

item.title: Lock Picker Exposes Glaring Flaws With Police Car Shotgun Lock
item.description: "I have to say I am more than a little disappointed with this."

item.title: Ferrari Driver Casually Hits 230 MPH On The Autobahn
item.description: What happens when you combine the famously high speeds of the German autobahn with the reduced traffic caused by the coronavirus lockdown?

item.title: TV Reporter Accidentally Films A Very NSFW Segment On Live TV
item.description: Here's another unexpected outcome of working from home: sometimes when you're filming live segments in your bathroom, your naked spouse might also be in the shot.

item.title: Here's The SAT Question That A 17-Year-Old Math Whiz Proved Was Wrong
item.description: Just because the SAT was designed to test the mathematical proficiency of students doesn't mean it's flawless.

item.title: This Dog Is Extremely Confused By The Missing Glass In Glass Door
item.description: Sometimes the glass is not a material obstacle but a state of mind.

item.title: Man Provides Hilarious Commentary Of Video Of A Cow Being Rescued From A Pool
item.description: It's not every day that we see a video of a cow being chased into a pool by dogs and then being rescued by cowboys.

item.title: Dog And Cat Handle The Increasingly Complicated Obstacle Course Their Owner Set Very Differently
item.description: Cats will be cats. Dogs will be dogs.

item.title: Here's A Perfect Encapsulation Of What Every Facebook Video Looks Like These Days
item.description: From the music to the captions, this is pitch perfect.

item.title: Watch This Stand-Off In Denver Between A Protester And Healthcare Worker
item.description: To protest the stay-at-home-orders, drivers attempted to clog certain roads in Denver, Colorado, on Sunday.

item.title: Michael Jordan Art Directed His Most Iconic Dunk By Himself
item.description: Michael Jordan helped out the veteran photographer Walter Iooss Jr. after telling him which way he was going to dunk in the contest. That tip led Iooss Jr. to capture an iconic moment in MJ's career.

item.title: Los Angeles Fills Venice Skate Park With Sand In An Effort To Keep Skateboarders Out During Quarantine
item.description: The county beach workers filled up the Venice Skatepark with sand.

item.title: The Slow Mo Guys Attempt To Break The Upper Limit Of YouTube's Compression Algorithm
item.description: Can the Slow Mo Guys break your YouTube?

item.title: Daredevil Bro Slams A Coke Bottle Into The Sky And Catches It On His Dirt Bike
item.description: Danny Duncan has been keeping himself active while social distancing — including, uh, whatever this is.

item.title: We Aren't Sure Whether This Potato Chip Omelette Hack Is The Worst Idea Ever Or Something Fun To Try
item.description: The food influencers at Chefclub came up with this, er, unconventional way to cook a Crispy Potato Chip Omelette, which is being hailed online as either brilliant or a crime against humanity.

item.title: Genius Designed A Basketball Hoop Where The Ball Always Goes In
item.description: A YouTuber wrote some software to come up with the most optimal basketball backboard possible and then built it.

item.title: Why Infiniti Is On The Verge Of Total Collapse
item.description: Doug DeMuro explains why the luxury car brand is on its way out of business.

item.title: A Useful Explainer On How To Cut Your Hair At Home
item.description: This guy explains how to cut your hair by yourself in a succinct and informative way.

item.title: Comedians Brilliantly Lampoon Bon Appétit's 'Gourmet Makes' By Attempting To Make Gourmet Four Loko
item.description: An absolutely spot on impression of Claire and Bon Appétit's shtick on YouTube.

item.title: Here's A Rare Glimpse At A Snow Leopard Shrieking Out Into The Void
item.description: The White Lion Foundation released an extraordinary, rare video of a snow leopard making a shriek caught on camera in the mountains of northern Pakistan.
item.kicker: MORE A SCREAM THAN A ROAR

item.title: A Demonstration Of How Easy It Is For Canadians To Receive Financial Relief Related To The Coronavirus
item.description: The surprisingly simple way to apply for the Canadian stimulus check.

item.title: This YouTuber Just Built A Mechanic Parent That Says Its Proud Of You If You Pay 25 Cents
item.description: The lengths we go for validation. Drop in 25 cents for a "pat on the back."

item.title: This Guy Discovering Aliens That Look Just Like Himself Might Be The Best TikTok Ever Made
item.description: This TikTok by Jeff Wright utilizing Parent Trap film technology and a science fiction premise keeps getting better and better the longer you watch.

item.title: Gymnast Breaks The Matrix, Pulls Off A True Standing Double Backflip On Grass
item.description: Kaleb Cave seems to have pulled off a true standing double backflip on grass. It's wild

item.title: Watch This American Woodcock And Its Babies Do Their Trademark Funky Walk
item.description: The American Woodcock's remarkably bouncy walk helps it stir up worms in the dirt and it's a terrific wonder to behold — especially when its younglings are getting the hang of the motion.

item.title: Music Teacher Creates A Soothing Song About COVID-19 That Is Not Blood-Curdling At All
item.description: During times of stress and hardship, we really need songs like this to help us manage our emotions.
item.kicker: LOWER YOUR VOLUME FOR THIS ONE

item.title: The Richest People In The World From 1997 To 2020, Visualized
item.description: Bill Gates may have been the richest person in the world in 1997, but here's how the rankings of the world's wealthiest individuals have changed in the past two decades.

item.title: Guy Notices A Fun Coincidence With The Super Mario Bros. Flagpole Fanfare Music And The Power-Up Sound Effect
item.description: Did Nintendo composer Koji Kondo hide an Easter egg inside Super Mario Bros.?

item.title: Watch Air Bubbles Move Through This 20-Million-Year-Old Amber Fossil
item.description: We've seen amber fossils with insects embedded in them before, but we've never seen one that contains air bubbles like this one.

item.title: Incredibly Resourceful Man Stranded On Island Gets The Attention Of Rescuers With Giant 'HELP' Sign
item.description: In the scene that seems straight out of a movie, a kayaker stranded on an island in Jamaica Bay caught the attention of NYPD Special Operations by starting a fire and spelling out "HELP" in sticks.

item.title: This Little Girl From Australia Pretty Much Sums Up How We're All Feeling Right Now
item.description: Dan Andrews, the premiere of Victoria, spoke to a few youngsters over Zoom and one had a keen takeaway from what we're all going through.
